head.title: Teaching standard - science - National Science Education Standards (NSES)

groups:concept.text: Teaching standard - science - National Science Education Standards (NSES)
groups:concept.deftn: a description of what educators of science should understand and be able to do

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard A Teachers of science plan an inquiry-based science program for their students:Develop a framework of yearlong and short-term goals for students
outline.text: Develop a framework of yearlong and short-term goals for students

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard A Teachers of science plan an inquiry-based science program for their students:Select science content and adapt and design curricula to meet the interests, knowledge, understanding, abilities, and experiences of students
outline.text: Select science content and adapt and design curricula to meet the interests, knowledge, understanding, abilities, and experiences of students

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard A Teachers of science plan an inquiry-based science program for their students:Select teaching and assessment strategies that support the development of student understanding and nurture a community of science learners
outline.text: Select teaching and assessment strategies that support the development of student understanding and nurture a community of science learners

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard A Teachers of science plan an inquiry-based science program for their students:Work together as colleagues within and across disciplines and grade levels
outline.text: Work together as colleagues within and across disciplines and grade levels

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard B Teachers of science guide and facilitate learning:Focus and support inquiries while interacting with students
outline.text: Focus and support inquiries while interacting with students

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard B Teachers of science guide and facilitate learning:Orchestrate discourse among students about scientific ideas
outline.text: Orchestrate discourse among students about scientific ideas

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard B Teachers of science guide and facilitate learning:Challenge students to accept and share responsibility for their own learning
outline.text: Challenge students to accept and share responsibility for their own learning

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard B Teachers of science guide and facilitate learning:Recognize and respond to student diversity and encourage all students to participate fully in science learning
outline.text: Recognize and respond to student diversity and encourage all students to participate fully in science learning

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard B Teachers of science guide and facilitate learning:Encourage and model the skills of scientific inquiry, as well as the curiosity, openness to new ideas and data, and skepticism that characterize science
outline.text: Encourage and model the skills of scientific inquiry, as well as the curiosity, openness to new ideas and data, and skepticism that characterize science

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard C Teachers of science engage in ongoing assessment of their teaching and of student learning:Use multiple methods and systematically gather data about student understanding and ability
outline.text: Use multiple methods and systematically gather data about student understanding and ability

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard C Teachers of science engage in ongoing assessment of their teaching and of student learning:Analyze assessment data to guide teaching
outline.text: Analyze assessment data to guide teaching

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard C Teachers of science engage in ongoing assessment of their teaching and of student learning:Guide students in self-assessment
outline.text: Guide students in self-assessment

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard C Teachers of science engage in ongoing assessment of their teaching and of student learning:Use student data, observations of teaching, and interactions with colleagues to reflect on and improve teaching practice
outline.text: Use student data, observations of teaching, and interactions with colleagues to reflect on and improve teaching practice

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard C Teachers of science engage in ongoing assessment of their teaching and of student learning:Use student data, observations of teaching, and interactions with colleagues to report student achievement and opportunities to learn to students, teachers, parents, policy makers, and the general public
outline.text: Use student data, observations of teaching, and interactions with colleagues to report student achievement and opportunities to learn to students, teachers, parents, policy makers, and the general public

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard D Teachers of science design and manage learning environments that provide students with the time, space, and resources needed for learning science:Structure the time available so that students are able to engage in extended investigations
outline.text: Structure the time available so that students are able to engage in extended investigations

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard D Teachers of science design and manage learning environments that provide students with the time, space, and resources needed for learning science:Create a setting for student work that is flexible and supportive of science inquiry
outline.text: Create a setting for student work that is flexible and supportive of science inquiry

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard D Teachers of science design and manage learning environments that provide students with the time, space, and resources needed for learning science:Ensure a safe working environment
outline.text: Ensure a safe working environment

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard D Teachers of science design and manage learning environments that provide students with the time, space, and resources needed for learning science:Make the available science tools, materials, media, and technological resources accessible to students
outline.text: Make the available science tools, materials, media, and technological resources accessible to students

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard D Teachers of science design and manage learning environments that provide students with the time, space, and resources needed for learning science:Identify and use resources outside the school
outline.text: Identify and use resources outside the school

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard D Teachers of science design and manage learning environments that provide students with the time, space, and resources needed for learning science:Engage students in designing the learning environment
outline.text: Engage students in designing the learning environment

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard E Teachers of science develop communities of science learners that reflect the intellectual rigor of scientific inquiry and the attitudes and social values conducive to science learning:Display and demand respect for the diverse ideas, skills, and experiences of all students
outline.text: Display and demand respect for the diverse ideas, skills, and experiences of all students

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard E Teachers of science develop communities of science learners that reflect the intellectual rigor of scientific inquiry and the attitudes and social values conducive to science learning:Enable students to have a significant voice in decisions about the content and context of their work and require students to take responsibility for the learning of all members of the community
outline.text: Enable students to have a significant voice in decisions about the content and context of their work and require students to take responsibility for the learning of all members of the community

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard E Teachers of science develop communities of science learners that reflect the intellectual rigor of scientific inquiry and the attitudes and social values conducive to science learning:Nurture collaboration among students
outline.text: Nurture collaboration among students

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard E Teachers of science develop communities of science learners that reflect the intellectual rigor of scientific inquiry and the attitudes and social values conducive to science learning:Structure and facilitate ongoing formal and informal discussion based on a shared understanding of rules of scientific discourse
outline.text: Structure and facilitate ongoing formal and informal discussion based on a shared understanding of rules of scientific discourse

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard E Teachers of science develop communities of science learners that reflect the intellectual rigor of scientific inquiry and the attitudes and social values conducive to science learning:Model and emphasize the skills, attitudes, and values of scientific inquiry
outline.text: Model and emphasize the skills, attitudes, and values of scientific inquiry

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard F Teachers of science actively participate in the ongoing planning and development of the school science program:Plan and develop the school science program
outline.text: Plan and develop the school science program

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard F Teachers of science actively participate in the ongoing planning and development of the school science program:Participate in decisions concerning the allocation of time and other resources to the science program
outline.text: Participate in decisions concerning the allocation of time and other resources to the science program

outline.groups:vocab: NSES:Teaching Standard F Teachers of science actively participate in the ongoing planning and development of the school science program:Participate fully in planning and implementing professional growth and development strategies for themselves and their colleagues
outline.text: Participate fully in planning and implementing professional growth and development strategies for themselves and their colleagues
